  • B is a node and A’s root is a shadow-including inclusive ancestor of B

then return A.
Set A to A’s root’s host.

algorithms.name: Element/HTML-uppercased qualified name
algorithms.html: An element’s HTML-uppercased qualified name is the return value of these steps:

steps.html: Let qualifiedName be this’s qualified name.
If this is in the HTML namespace and its node document is an HTML document, then set qualifiedName to qualifiedName in ASCII uppercase.
Return <var>qualifiedName</var>.

algorithms.name: create an element
algorithms.html: To create an element, given a document document, string localName, string-or-null namespace, and optionally a string-or-null prefix (default null), string-or-null is (default null), boolean synchronousCustomElements (default false), and "default", null, or a CustomElementRegistry object registry (default "default"):

steps.html: Let result be null.
If registry is "default", then set registry to the result of looking up a custom element registry given document.
Let definition be the result of looking up a custom element definition given registry, namespace, localName, and is.
If definition is non-null, and definition’s name is not equal to its local name (i.e., definition represents a customized built-in element):
Let interface be the element interface for localName and the HTML namespace.
Set result to the result of creating an element internal given document, interface, localName, the HTML namespace, prefix, "undefined", is, and registry.

If <var>synchronousCustomElements</var> is true, then run this step while catching any
    exceptions:
Upgrade result using definition.

additional.html: If this step threw an exception <var>exception</var>:

steps.html: Report exception for definition’s constructor’s corresponding JavaScript object’s associated realm’s global object.
Set result’s custom element state to "failed".
Otherwise, enqueue a custom element upgrade reaction given result and definition.
Otherwise, if <var>definition</var> is non-null:
If <var>synchronousCustomElements</var> is true:
Let C be definition’s constructor.
Set the surrounding agent’s active custom element constructor map[C] to registry.
Run these steps while catching any exceptions:
Set result to the result of constructing C, with no arguments.
Assert: result’s custom element state and custom element definition are initialized.
Assert: result’s namespace is the HTML namespace.
If result’s attribute list is not empty, then throw a "NotSupportedError" DOMException.
If result has children, then throw a "NotSupportedError" DOMException.
If result’s parent is not null, then throw a "NotSupportedError" DOMException.
If result’s node document is not document, then throw a "NotSupportedError" DOMException.
If result’s local name is not equal to localName, then throw a "NotSupportedError" DOMException.
Set result’s namespace prefix to prefix.
Set result’s is value to null.
Set result’s custom element registry to registry.

additional.html: If any of these steps threw an exception <var>exception</var>:

steps.html: Report exception for definition’s constructor’s corresponding JavaScript object’s associated realm’s global object.
Set result to the result of creating an element internal given document, HTMLUnknownElement, localName, the HTML namespace, prefix, "failed", null, and registry.
Remove the surrounding agent’s active custom element constructor map[C].
Otherwise:
Set result to the result of creating an element internal given document, HTMLElement, localName, the HTML namespace, prefix, "undefined", null, and registry.
Enqueue a custom element upgrade reaction given result and definition.
Otherwise:
Let interface be the element interface for localName and namespace.
Set result to the result of creating an element internal given document, interface, localName, namespace, prefix, "uncustomized", is, and registry.
If namespace is the HTML namespace, and either localName is a valid custom element name or is is non-null, then set result’s custom element state to "undefined".
Return result.

algorithms.name: create an element internal
algorithms.html: To create an element internal given a document document, an interface interface a string localName, a string-or-null namespace, a string-or-null prefix, a string state, a string-or-null is, and null or a CustomElementRegistry object registry:

steps.html: Let element be a new element that implements interface, with namespace set to namespace, namespace prefix set to prefix, local name set to localName, custom element registry set to registry, custom element state set to state, custom element definition set to null, is value set to is, and node document set to document.
Assert: element’s attribute list is empty.
Return element.

algorithms.name: handle attribute changes
algorithms.html: To handle attribute changes for an attribute attribute with element, oldValue, and newValue, run these steps:

steps.html: Queue a mutation record of "attributes" for element with attribute’s local name, attribute’s namespace, oldValue, « », « », null, and null.

If element is custom, then enqueue a custom element callback reaction with element, callback name "attributeChangedCallback", and « attribute’s local name, oldValue, newValue, attribute’s namespace ».
Run the attribute change steps with element, attribute’s local name, oldValue, newValue, and attribute’s namespace.

algorithms.name: change an attribute
algorithms.html: To change an attribute attribute to value, run these steps:

steps.html: Let oldValue be attribute’s value.
Set attribute’s value to value.
Handle attribute changes for attribute with attribute’s element, oldValue, and value.

algorithms.name: append an attribute
algorithms.html: To append an attribute attribute to an element element, run these steps:

steps.html: Append attribute to element’s attribute list.
Set attribute’s element to element.
Set attribute’s node document to element’s node document.
Handle attribute changes for attribute with element, null, and attribute’s value.

algorithms.name: remove an attribute
algorithms.html: To remove an attribute attribute, run these steps:

steps.html: Let element be attribute’s element.
Remove attribute from element’s attribute list.
Set attribute’s element to null.
Handle attribute changes for attribute with element, attribute’s value, and null.

algorithms.name: replace an attribute
algorithms.html: To replace an attribute oldAttribute with an attribute newAttribute:

steps.html: Let element be oldAttribute’s element.
Replace oldAttribute by newAttribute in element’s attribute list.
Set newAttribute’s element to element.
Set newAttribute’s node document to element’s node document.
Set oldAttribute’s element to null.
Handle attribute changes for oldAttribute with element, oldAttribute’s value, and newAttribute’s value.

algorithms.name: get an attribute by name
algorithms.html: To get an attribute by name given a string qualifiedName and an element element:

steps.html: If element is in the HTML namespace and its node document is an HTML document, then set qualifiedName to qualifiedName in ASCII lowercase.
Return the first attribute in element’s attribute list whose qualified name is qualifiedName; otherwise null.

algorithms.name: get an attribute by namespace and local name
algorithms.html: To get an attribute by namespace and local name given null or a string namespace, a string localName, and an element element:

steps.html: If namespace is the empty string, then set it to null.
Return the attribute in element’s attribute list whose namespace is namespace and local name is localName, if any; otherwise null.

algorithms.name: get an attribute value
algorithms.html: To get an attribute value given an element element, a string localName, and an optional null or string namespace (default null):

steps.html: Let attr be the result of getting an attribute given namespace, localName, and element.
If attr is null, then return the empty string.
Return attr’s value.

algorithms.name: set an attribute
algorithms.html: To set an attribute given an attribute attr and an element element:

steps.html: If attr’s element is neither null nor element, throw an "InUseAttributeError" DOMException.
Let oldAttr be the result of getting an attribute given attr’s namespace, attr’s local name, and element.
If oldAttr is attr, return attr.
If oldAttr is non-null, then replace oldAttr with attr.
Otherwise, append attr to element.
Return oldAttr.

algorithms.name: set an attribute value
algorithms.html: To set an attribute value given an element element, a string localName, a string value, an optional null or string prefix (default null), and an optional null or string namespace (default null):

steps.html: Let attribute be the result of getting an attribute given namespace, localName, and element.

If attribute is null, create an attribute whose namespace is namespace, namespace prefix is prefix, local name is localName, value is value, and node document is element’s node document, then append this attribute to element, and then return.
Change attribute to value.

algorithms.name: remove an attribute by name
algorithms.html: To remove an attribute by name given a string qualifiedName and an element element:

steps.html: Let attr be the result of getting an attribute given qualifiedName and element.
If attr is non-null, then remove attr.
Return attr.

algorithms.name: remove an attribute by namespace and local name
algorithms.html: To remove an attribute by namespace and local name given null or a string namespace, a string localName, and an element element:

steps.html: Let attr be the result of getting an attribute given namespace, localName, and element.
If attr is non-null, then remove attr.
Return attr.

algorithms.html: Use these attribute change steps to update an element’s ID:

steps.html: If localName is id, namespace is null, and value is null or the empty string, then unset element’s ID.
Otherwise, if localName is id, namespace is null, then set element’s ID to value.

algorithms.name: Element/getAttribute(qualifiedName)
algorithms.html: The getAttribute(qualifiedName) method steps are:

steps.html: Let attr be the result of getting an attribute given qualifiedName and this.
If attr is null, return null.
Return attr’s value.

algorithms.name: Element/getAttributeNS(namespace, localName)
algorithms.html: The getAttributeNS(namespace, localName) method steps are:

steps.html: Let attr be the result of getting an attribute given namespace, localName, and this.
If attr is null, return null.
Return attr’s value.

algorithms.name: Element/setAttribute(qualifiedName, value)
algorithms.html: The setAttribute(qualifiedName, value) method steps are:

steps.html: If qualifiedName is not a valid attribute local name, then throw an "InvalidCharacterError" DOMException.
If this is in the HTML namespace and its node document is an HTML document, then set qualifiedName to qualifiedName in ASCII lowercase.
Let attribute be the first attribute in this’s attribute list whose qualified name is qualifiedName, and null otherwise.
If attribute is null, create an attribute whose local name is qualifiedName, value is value, and node document is this’s node document, then append this attribute to this, and then return.
Change attribute to value.

Return s.

algorithms.name: filter
algorithms.html: To filter a node node within a NodeIterator or TreeWalker object traverser, run these steps:

steps.html: If traverser’s active flag is set, then throw an "InvalidStateError" DOMException.
Let n be node’s nodeType attribute value − 1.
If the nth bit (where 0 is the least significant bit) of traverser’s whatToShow is not set, then return FILTER_SKIP.
If traverser’s filter is null, then return FILTER_ACCEPT.
Set traverser’s active flag.

Let result be the return value of call a user object’s operation with traverser’s filter, "acceptNode", and « node ». If this throws an exception, then unset traverser’s active flag and rethrow the exception.
Unset traverser’s active flag.
Return result.

algorithms.name: NodeIterator pre-remove steps
algorithms.html: The NodeIterator pre-remove steps given a nodeIterator and toBeRemovedNode, are as follows:

steps.html: If toBeRemovedNode is not an inclusive ancestor of nodeIterator’s reference, or toBeRemovedNode is nodeIterator’s root, then return.
If nodeIterator’s pointer before reference is true:
Let next be toBeRemovedNode’s first following node that is an inclusive descendant of nodeIterator’s root and is not an inclusive descendant of toBeRemovedNode, and null if there is no such node.
If next is non-null, then set nodeIterator’s reference to next and return.
Otherwise, set nodeIterator’s pointer before reference to false.

Set nodeIterator’s reference to toBeRemovedNode’s parent, if toBeRemovedNode’s previous sibling is null, and to the inclusive descendant of toBeRemovedNode’s previous sibling that appears last in tree order otherwise.

algorithms.name: NodeIterator/traverse
algorithms.html: To traverse, given a NodeIterator object iterator and a direction direction, run these steps:

steps.html: Let node be iterator’s reference.
Let beforeNode be iterator’s pointer before reference.
While true:
Branch on <var>direction</var>:

If beforeNode is false, then set node to the first node following node in iterator’s iterator collection. If there is no such node, then return null.

If beforeNode is true, then set it to false.

If beforeNode is true, then set node to the first node preceding node in iterator’s iterator collection. If there is no such node, then return null.

If beforeNode is false, then set it to true.
Let result be the result of filtering node within iterator.
If result is FILTER_ACCEPT, then break.
Set iterator’s reference to node.
Set iterator’s pointer before reference to beforeNode.
Return node.

algorithms.name: TreeWalker/parentNode()
algorithms.html: The parentNode() method steps are:

steps.html: Let node be this’s current.
While node is non-null and is not this’s root:
Set node to node’s parent.
If node is non-null and filtering node within this returns FILTER_ACCEPT, then set this’s current to node and return node.
Return null.

algorithms.name: TreeWalker/traverse children
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="TreeWalker" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="concept-traverse-children" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">traverse children</dfn>, given a <var>walker</var> and <var>type</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: Let node be walker’s current.
Set node to node’s first child if type is first, and node’s last child if type is last.
While <var>node</var> is non-null:
Let result be the result of filtering node within walker.
If result is FILTER_ACCEPT, then set walker’s current to node and return node.
If result is FILTER_SKIP:
Let child be node’s first child if type is first, and node’s last child if type is last.
If child is non-null, then set node to child and continue.
While <var>node</var> is non-null:
Let sibling be node’s next sibling if type is first, and node’s previous sibling if type is last.
If sibling is non-null, then set node to sibling and break.
Let parent be node’s parent.
If parent is null, walker’s root, or walker’s current, then return null.
Set node to parent.
Return null.

algorithms.name: traverse siblings
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="concept-traverse-siblings" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">traverse siblings</dfn>, given a <var>walker</var> and <var>type</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: Let node be walker’s current.
If node is root, then return null.
While true:
Let sibling be node’s next sibling if type is next, and node’s previous sibling if type is previous.
While <var>sibling</var> is non-null:
Set node to sibling.
Let result be the result of filtering node within walker.
If result is FILTER_ACCEPT, then set walker’s current to node and return node.
Set sibling to node’s first child if type is next, and node’s last child if type is previous.
If result is FILTER_REJECT or sibling is null, then set sibling to node’s next sibling if type is next, and node’s previous sibling if type is previous.
Set node to node’s parent.
If node is null or walker’s root, then return null.
If the return value of filtering node within walker is FILTER_ACCEPT, then return null.

algorithms.name: TreeWalker/previousNode()
algorithms.html: The previousNode() method steps are:

steps.html: Let node be this’s current.
While node is not this’s root:
Let sibling be node’s previous sibling.
While <var>sibling</var> is non-null:
Set node to sibling.
Let result be the result of filtering node within this.
While result is not FILTER_REJECT and node has a child:
Set node to node’s last child.
Set result to the result of filtering node within this.
If result is FILTER_ACCEPT, then set this’s current to node and return node.
Set sibling to node’s previous sibling.
If node is this’s root or node’s parent is null, then return null.
Set node to node’s parent.
If the return value of filtering node within this is FILTER_ACCEPT, then set this’s current to node and return node.
Return null.

algorithms.name: TreeWalker/nextNode()
algorithms.html: The nextNode() method steps are:

steps.html: Let node be this’s current.
Let result be FILTER_ACCEPT.
While true:
While result is not FILTER_REJECT and node has a child:
Set node to its first child.
Set result to the result of filtering node within this.
If result is FILTER_ACCEPT, then set this’s current to node and return node.
Let sibling be null.
Let temporary be node.
While <var>temporary</var> is non-null:
If temporary is this’s root, then return null.
Set sibling to temporary’s next sibling.
If sibling is non-null, then set node to sibling and break.
Set temporary to temporary’s parent.
Set result to the result of filtering node within this.
If result is FILTER_ACCEPT, then set this’s current to node and return node.

algorithms.name: DOMTokenList/validation steps
algorithms.html: A DOMTokenList object’s validation steps for a given token are:

steps.html: If the associated attribute’s local name does not define supported tokens, throw a TypeError.
Let lowercase token be a copy of token, in ASCII lowercase.
If lowercase token is present in supported tokens, return true.
Return false.

algorithms.name: DOMTokenList/update steps
algorithms.html: A DOMTokenList object’s update steps are:

steps.html: If the associated element does not have an associated attribute and token set is empty, then return.
Set an attribute value for the associated element using associated attribute’s local name and the result of running the ordered set serializer for token set.

algorithms.html: A DOMTokenList object has these attribute change steps for its associated element:

steps.html: If localName is associated attribute’s local name, namespace is null, and value is null, then empty token set.
Otherwise, if localName is associated attribute’s local name, namespace is null, then set token set to value, parsed.

algorithms.html: When a DOMTokenList object is created, then:

steps.html: Let element be associated element.
Let localName be associated attribute’s local name.
Let value be the result of getting an attribute value given element and localName.
Run the attribute change steps for element, localName, value, value, and null.

algorithms.name: DOMTokenList/item(index)
algorithms.html: The item(index) method steps are:

steps.html: If index is equal to or greater than this’s token set’s size, then return null.
Return this’s token set[index].

algorithms.name: DOMTokenList/add(...tokens)
algorithms.html: The add(tokens…) method steps are:

steps.html: For each token of tokens:
If token is the empty string, then throw a "SyntaxError" DOMException.
If token contains any ASCII whitespace, then throw an "InvalidCharacterError" DOMException.
For each token of tokens, append token to this’s token set.
Run the update steps.

algorithms.name: DOMTokenList/remove(...tokens)
algorithms.html: The remove(tokens…) method steps are:

steps.html: For each token of tokens:
If token is the empty string, then throw a "SyntaxError" DOMException.
If token contains any ASCII whitespace, then throw an "InvalidCharacterError" DOMException.
For each token in tokens, remove token from this’s token set.
Run the update steps.

algorithms.name: DOMTokenList/toggle(token, force)
algorithms.html: The toggle(token, force) method steps are:

steps.html: If token is the empty string, then throw a "SyntaxError" DOMException.
If token contains any ASCII whitespace, then throw an "InvalidCharacterError" DOMException.
If this’s token set[token] exists:
If force is either not given or is false, then remove token from this’s token set, run the update steps and return false.
Return true.
Otherwise, if force not given or is true, append token to this’s token set, run the update steps, and return true.
Return false.

algorithms.name: DOMTokenList/replace(token, newToken)
algorithms.html: The replace(token, newToken) method steps are:

steps.html: If either token or newToken is the empty string, then throw a "SyntaxError" DOMException.
If either token or newToken contains any ASCII whitespace, then throw an "InvalidCharacterError" DOMException.
If this’s token set does not contain token, then return false.
Replace token in this’s token set with newToken.
Run the update steps.
Return true.

algorithms.name: DOMTokenList/supports(token)
algorithms.html: The supports(token) method steps are:

steps.html: Let result be the return value of validation steps called with token.
Return result.
